intro: Hohenackeria, commonly known as the common hohenackeria, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and compound leaves with a distinct, fern-like appearance. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Hohenackeria species are often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
